name: vanilla.smartfloat
description:
SmartFloat is a class-based representation of a primitive float value. This allows it to be accessed by reference rather than value such that it acts more like a classic C++ pointer.

Also, it has a number of validation values and behaviour built in such as same-value-set protection, min/max range and change detection events.

samples.description: Demonstrates some very basic implementations of SmartFloat.
